channel.title: Articulo
channel.description: Your reading list as a podcast
channel.itunes:author: Me

item.title: The Grug Brained Developer
item.description: A layman's guide to thinking like the self-aware smol brained.

item.title: Once More to the Lake
item.description: First published in Harper’s magazine in 1941, “Once More to the Lake” narrates White’s visit to Belgrade Lakes, Maine, where he had vacationed as a child..

item.title: Sunday Morning
item.description: This is the later and more definitive version of “Sunday Morning.” In 1915, editor Harriet Monroe asked Stevens to cut several stanzas for Poetry, and Stevens would later restore these cut stanzas when he published the poem in book form in 1923.
